Question: output as UTF-8 encoding in java: :I am having problem with the output file from a program using eclipse .i set my eclipse to UTF-8 and with  System.getProperty("file.encoding") i get UTF-8.i ran my prog via eclipse run-option and the output (a text file) is encoded in UTF-8.but when i compressed the source code into a jar file,the output file shows error in some of the alphabet like Ã.what is with this diff when ruuning the prog in eclipse and frm jar file?and do i have to specify the output to be encoded in utf-8 in my source code?pls help.help from @dacwe indeed produced the desired output.but may i know how can i run my executable .jar file outside command line?how can the -Dfile.encoding=UTF-8 @dacwe :i tried changing my source code into  BufferedWriter bout  = new java.io.BufferedWriter(new java.io.OutputStreamWriter(                new java.io.FileOutputStream(filename), "UTF-8"));but the output still is not encoded correctly.anything i miss here?

response:
The issue you are facing is due to the fact that when you run your program from the command line, the default encoding used by the operating system may be different from the UTF-8 encoding that you have set in Eclipse. To ensure that the output file is encoded in UTF-8, you need to specify the encoding when you create the PrintWriter object.

To do this, you can use the following code:
```java
PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(new FileWriter(filename, true), "UTF-8");
```
Here, the second argument to the PrintWriter constructor is the file writer object, and the third argument is the encoding ("UTF-8" in this case). This will ensure that the output file is created in UTF-8 encoding.

Regarding running the executable jar file outside the command line, you can do this by following these steps:

1. Open the "Run" dialog box in Eclipse by clicking on "Run" in the menu bar and selecting "Run Configurations".
2. Select your jar file from the list of available configurations.
3. Click on the "Arguments" tab and add the following argument: `-Dfile.encoding=UTF-8`.
4. Click "Apply" and then "Run".

This will run your jar file with the specified encoding, and the output file should be created in UTF-8 encoding.
